page.title: 01CAMBUSNETHAN & NEWMAINS I
page.content: The{landscape}of this area is very much a result of{human interference. This is shown by the large areas of housing and wasteland. There is a wide variety of housing types resulting from the early development of this area. Prior to 1914 this consisted of linear or ribbon development along the{A722}(West to East- Kirk Road, Cambusnethan Street both Wishaw and Manse Road, Newmains). As well as this there were a number of nodes especially around Newmains Cross housing the workers of the Coltness Iron Works{(GR. 823553),}Coltness Colliery, Bailliesmuir Pit No. 1{(GR. {825566)}and Moss Colliery as well as the numerous clay pits. Another node is Bonkle Village{(GR. 836569),}a village connected with the local estate.
